location: 120 S La Salle St, Chicago, IL 60603
job_Description: Tegus is the leading market intelligence platform for key decision makers. We power some of the world’s most well-respected institutional investors, corporations, and consultancies through the largest and most comprehensive database of primary and market information. Our products and services enable clients to discover unmatched insights and answers to the most challenging questions they face to help them make better informed decisions. As a Sr. Data Analyst, you will help empower decision-making at Tegus in a dynamic, collaborative operating environment. In this role you will work with Product, Operations, Sales, Marketing, and upper management to conduct analyses that deliver on strategic initiatives. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining recurring reports, dashboards, and structured analyses to support business decisions. To help sustain the health of the data infrastructure, you will identify, define, and share requirements for data collection, transformation, and delivery.  Responsibilities Create and own an end-to-end, repeatable process for delivering data and analyses to business stakeholders, including data modeling and building data pipelines. Develop insightful dashboards and reports built from robust datasets. Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver data-driven product and business insights. Conduct investigative analyses and monitor the quality of data and analytic processes. Respond promptly to ad hoc data and dashboard requests.  Qualifications Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field like engineering, statistics, or economics. Minimum of three years working in a data analytics role. Expertise working in SQL, bonus for programming languages like Python and R. Strong experience building dashboards in an enterprise business intelligence system. Demonstrated success in creating compelling data visualizations and translating data narratives into business insights for cross-functional audiences. Experience and willingness to do data modeling and basic ETL to build data pipelines.  Benefits & Perks Remote-friendly - work wherever you're most productive (Note: this position is not currently open to Colorado residents). Comprehensive medical and dental plans, plus long-term disability and 401k match. Generous parental leave for all parents. Unlimited paid vacation and flexible work hours. The opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a thriving growth-stage company and make a big impact on our business. Fantastic culture with regular virtual company-wide events, including cooking classes, yoga, meditation and more. And for candidates in Chicago: The option to work from a state of the art office in the heart of Chicago’s Loop featuring standing desks, mother rooms, gender neutral bathrooms and full amenity floor. Upon returning to the office, we also offer commuter benefits & a fully stocked kitchen with rotating snacks and beverages.  Tegus, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Tegus complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Tegus expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

Mission  YOUR FUNCTION:  Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.  A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.  As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.  You have experience in one or more of these domains:   You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.  Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)  Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment  Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment  Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)   Profile  YOUR PROFILE   You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience  You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends  Have at least 3 years’ experience in implementing data solution and analytics  You are fluent in Python or R  Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning  You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow…)  Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.  Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology  Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology  You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems  You have a pro-active, can-do mindset  You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).   You get bonus points if…   You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients  You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops   OUR OFFER:   The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference  The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities  Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need  Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices and home working  32 days of annual leave, because life isn’t all about working  Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card  Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you  And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!   Interested? Questions? Recommendations? For more information, contact our recruiter Victoria Maximova directly: 02 801 58 36  Organization  Inetum Realdolmen, a member of the European Inetum Group with approximately 1,950 highly qualified employees, provides strategic, tactical and operational ICT solutions for over 1,000 customers throughout the Benelux. In every cooperation, Realdolmen realizes the potential of people and organizations and strives to keep ICT human. We are driven by technological innovation, but we advance at the speed of your ambition, results-focused and managing fundamental change. Our company motto "New Challenges, New Ideas" reflects this.  An employer you really want to work for! Not only is Realdolmen a no-nonsense, solid, stable and experienced company with great in-house knowledge and expertise, but we also put our employees first: every individual receives the attention they need. ‘Heart for People' is more than just words for us – it's one of our very core values. Satellite offices, extensive training opportunities, work-life balance, competence reviews and career opportunities: these are no empty promises for us. Our organization attaches great importance to diversity. We guarantee an objective selection process, whereby candidates are tested and selected solely on the basis of their qualities and skills.  With us it's all about you!  Country  Belgium Location  Customers' offices, Inetum-Realdolmen offices or home office Contract type  Permanent contract Apply

Company Summary: Nikon Research Corporation of America (NRCA)  located in Belmont, CA and Tucson, AZ is a 70-person R&D subsidiary of Nikon, Japan. Members of our Precision Mechatronics group design and build prototype systems to support Nikon’s Next Generation Project Division efforts to invent new products that will power Nikon’s future. Examples of the products we work on are metal 3D printers, precision measurement and robotics, industrial metrology tools, optical measurement equipment, and semiconductor lithography machines (wafer steppers). The engineering is challenging and fun, because with micron- and nanometer-level accuracy everything (e.g., mechanical stiffness, thermal expansion, actuator linearity, sensor accuracy, acoustic vibration, structural resonance) matters. The work environment is great because we have the informality and flexibility of a small company, but the stability and resources of a big parent in Japan. Position Title:  Deep Learning Engineer (Contractor) Compensation:  $50-60/hour Location:  Remote Position Type:  Contractor Estimated contract length:  This is a temporary, contract role with an expected duration of 6 months Shift:  Flexible schedule 20-40 hours per week; mandatory meeting for Asia Pacific calls twice/week from 4:00-9:00 pm PDT Travel:  None Position Overview: Members of our Precision Mechatronics group perform research projects that lead to future products for Nikon’s precision equipment business groups. NRCA is looking for a Deep Learning Engineer who is a creative thinker and team player with a passion for cutting edge research. Your Next Challenge: Develop deep learning algorithms in support of Nikon products and applications Research and test new techniques and algorithms Work alongside Software, Robotics and Hardware teams to develop algorithms If you have all of the following, please apply: Currently enrolled in Masters’ (or +) level degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Electrical Engineer program. You must understand neural network systems. Image processing experience is a must. Required Skills/Abilities: US work authorization (Required) Unable to provide sponsorship for contractor positions Strong understanding of Deep Learning; proficient in training and evaluating state of the art Deep Networks for Classification, Semantic & Instance Segmentation, and Object Detection, Action Recognition and Object Tracking; exposure to 3D Deep Learning Proficient in DL development frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch Strong C++ and Python programming skills Experience with common ML/CV tools including python/bash scripting, scikit-learn, OpenCV etc. Compress, quantize and optimize the architecture of the deep learning network Knowledge of mathematical and statistical optimization theory and techniques Experience with statistical computer vision and image processing Working knowledge and/or experience with DL inference hardware and edge device is a big plus This is a contract opportunity, not a full-time employment role. Other job requirements: For the health and safety of our workplace, proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required for hiring of candidates and employment of new hires after the Effective Date of this Policy (12/9/2021). However, if a candidate is unable to be vaccinated for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs, the Company will consider requests from candidates for reasonable accommodation consistent with our policy, and where we are able to provide such accommodations without undue hardship to the Company pursuant to applicable law. Equal Employment Opportunity: Nikon Research Corporation of America is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. The Company will reasonably accommodate candidates and employees with a disability, medical condition or sincerely held religious beliefs, observances, or practices so that the individual can perform the essential functions of a job, unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace (and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation) or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to Company. Please let Human Resources know if you’d like to request an accommodation. Privacy Notice and Consent: Under the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (“CCPA”) and other applicable privacy regulations, Nikon Research Corporation of America (NRCA) is required to disclose whenever personal information is collected from you in certain contexts, such as to provide or receive a product or service. If you have a visual disability, you may be able to use a screen reader or other tools to review the contents of this notice. More information about NRCAs Privacy Policy is available at: https://www.nikonprecision.com/privacy/. For CA Residents, please carefully review NRCAs Supplemental CCPA Privacy Policy available at: https://www.nikonprecision.com/privacy/caresidentsonly/. By clicking “apply,” you authorize and give your consent for NRCA to use the personal information you provided for future communications related to the recruitment and hiring process, both for current and future job openings (“Purpose”). You further certify that you are over 18 years of age. NRCA may be required to provide your contact information to third parties in order to perform the above Purpose. However, NRCA does not sell, rent, or lease your personal information to third parties. Education Preferred Masters/Science or better in Electrical Engineering or related field Masters/Science or better in Computer Engineering or related field Masters/Science or better in Engineering or related field Behaviors Preferred Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity Motivations Preferred Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business

It’s Time For A Change… Your Future Evolves Here At Vital Decisions, a subsidiary of New Century Health, our mission is to ensure that every individual is seen and heard when it comes to their medical care. We help people facing serious health conditions advocate for the experience they want, feel in control of their medical choices, avoid chaos in a crisis, and improve the quality and value of the care they receive. This human-centered mission and focus on personal values is changing the way health care is delivered. Being a catalyst for change, and touching thousands of lives, is the driving force that brings us to work each day.  Our parent company, Evolent Health, was the first organization ever to receive NCQA’s Population Health Program Accreditation, and is consistently recognized as one of Becker’s Healthcare 150 Top Places to Work. We constantly embrace new ideas, challenge ourselves and fail forward. We respect and celebrate individual talents and team wins. We recognize employees that live our values, give back to our communities each year, and are champions for bringing our whole selves to work each day. If you’re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don’t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it. What You’ll Be Doing: Who You’ll Be Working With: The Sr. Data Scientist leads Vital Decisions’ analytical and AI strategy to support the design, development and delivery of Vital Decisions’ services to the right individuals at the right time, ensuring medical care that an individual receives during an advanced illness aligns with the individual’s goals and quality of life priorities over time as one progresses toward end of life. Using data sciences skill sets and advanced quantitative analytic methods, the Sr. Data Scientist provides thought leadership and hands on technical expertise in the creation and presenting of analytics and insights that prospectively identify client opportunities, retrospectively demonstrate accurate program performance, and continuously improve program value and impact. The leader in this position will be client-facing and have primary accountability for executing and delivering clear and accurate return on investment (ROI) and related outcomes plausibility analyses. The Sr. Data Scientist serve as a subject matter expert supporting Vital Decisions’ neural network and machine learning strategy to drive product innovation What You’ll Be Doing: The Sr. Data Scientist will support building of AI products in Agile fashion that empower healthcare payers, providers, and members to quickly process medical data to making informed decisions and overall reduce health care costs. Sr. Data Scientist will have the opportunity to lead a team, shape team culture and operating norms because of the fast-paced nature of a high-growth organization. Specially they will lead the following functions: Mortality Modeling: Design AI models to accurately predict individuals who will benefit most from Vital Decisions’ services. End of Life Medical Cost Prediction: Lead, design, and manage research into end of life cost drivers, patterns of medical utilization, actionable segmentations and stratifications  Product and Analytics Road Map: Determine highest ROI product and enhancements to support business objectives Thought Leadership: Develop white papers and studies suitable for publication as a leader in the space; share outcomes and insights at conferences and other forums Return on Investment (ROI): Design and develop new methodologies to measure and evaluate customer return on investment. Opportunity Assessment (OA): Support sales with accurate, clear and timely opportunity assessments for prospective clients – with and the without access to prospect claims data  The Experience You’ll Need (Required): Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related field. Masters or Doctorate level preferred; and/or extensive work-related experience will be considered 6+ years of Industry experience as a data scientist or Machine learning scientist with 1+ years of leading a Data science team Own the Data science, machine learning and AI products from platforms to systems for model training, versioning, deploying, storage and testing models with creating real time feedback loops to fully automated services Finishing Touches (Preferred): Proven ability to create data analytics and build models using advanced techniques and tools Solid programing skills to develop repeatable analytic and reporting processes Proficiency working with BI and visualization tools Strong process management, critical thinking, problem solving, and decision making Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills Excellent time and priority management to support multiple concurrent initiatives and priorities Proven leadership or active participation in peer communities Experience developing content for publications for academic journals Comfort level and ease presenting analysis, results, and insights to health plan clients including C-suite with confidence and credibility; Up to 50% of this role may be client facing Project a positive, solutions oriented attitude along with core company values Technical requirements: Currently, Evolent employees work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19. As such, we require that all employees have the following technical capability at their home: High speed internet over 10 MBPS and, specifically for all call center employees, the ability to plug in directly to the home internet router. These at-home technical requirements are subject to change with any scheduled re-opening of our office locations Evolent Health is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status. Technical requirements: Currently, Evolent employees work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19. As such, we require that all employees have the following technical capability at their home: High speed internet over 10 MBPS and, specifically for all call center employees, the ability to plug in directly to the home internet router. These at-home technical requirements are subject to change with any scheduled re-opening of our office locations. Description:  Machine Learning Engineer Location:  Chennai, India Work from home flexible but individuals must be eligible to work in Chennai, India without sponsorship Description Inspire is one of the largest healthcare social networking companies in the US with over 2 million members. This role will work on building recommendation systems and NLP models to personalize content and recommend social media posts for members on Inspire' social media platform. You will be able to build models on large real-world data sets containing tens of millions of social media posts, healthcare data, and user behavior data points. You'll be developing models, A/B testing them, iterating, and putting models in production. If this role interests you, apply below! WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING This role will focus on personalization and recommendations. In this role you will: Build recommendation systems to recommend posts to members based on their user behavior, viewing history, and interests Build deep learning language models to understand text data for classification tasks and for recommender system features Build, deploy, and maintain deep learning models using Amazon Sagemaker Come up with innovative ideas and experiments to increase user satisfaction, engagement, and retention to use in personalization models Follow the latest developments in machine learning, recommender systems, NLP, and data science research to inform the management of new opportunities . Requirements: Ability to build deep learning NLP models for classification Ability to build recommendation systems using collaborative filtering and deep neural nets Experienced using deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow Experience using methods and techniques in NLP such as transfer learning, hyperparameter tuning, and data augmentation Experience working with NLP embedding models such as word2vec and BERT Ability to deploy models to a cloud platform such as AWS, GCP, or Azure or using flask and docker Full-time employees are eligible for:  Competitive salary and benefits Quarterly performance bonus Health insurance, including dental and vision Job Type: Full-time

Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE:  GCI) is a subscription-led and digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to empowering communities to thrive. With an unmatched reach at the national and local level, Gannett touches the lives of millions with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services. Our current portfolio of media assets includes USA TODAY, local media organizations in 46 states in the U.S., and Newsquest, a wholly owned subsidiary operating in the United Kingdom with more than 120 local news media brands. Gannett also owns the digital marketing services companies ReachLocal, Inc., UpCurve, Inc., and WordStream, Inc., which are marketed under the LOCALiQ brand, and runs the largest media-owned events business in the U.S., USA TODAY NETWORK Ventures. To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com. Sr. Data Scientist, Audience Science The Data Science group which is a part of Gannett’s Enterprise Data Organization, designs and develops machine learning models and decision science solutions that enable our cross-functional partners across Product, Content and Marketing teams to predict performance, better understand audiences and then engage them with meaningful and delightful content experiences.  What you’ll do: In this exciting leadership opportunity, you will have the unique opportunity to roll up your sleeves and lead our core data science hub for the most central part of our business – Audience! Your role will directly impact how millions of our users across the communities we serve in connect and engage with our content and our products. Our ideal candidate is a collaborative and innovative problem solver, who is profoundly hands-on and is passionate about applying state-of-the-art solution frameworks and machine learning techniques to develop behavioral segments, audience propensities and other data products that embed strategic audience insights into Gannett’s daily decisions and value chains.  How you’ll make an impact:   Develop and/or improve predictive models to identify lookalike and high-propensity audiences to be targeted for acquisition, retention, and engagement.  Build behavior segments and personas by analyzing user preferences and affinities across the customer journey.  Analyze behavioral trends to uncover opportunities to improve overall personalization, as well as content, and product performance.  Understand the data deeply and effectively translate model outcomes and insights into actions and recommendations that lead to decisions and measurable ROI.   What you'll bring:   MS or PhD in a quantitative field, with 8+ years of hands-on experience in building, evaluating, deploying, and monitoring machine learning solutions in production to solve business problems.  Advanced knowledge of models for classification, regression, and time-series modeling. Deep learning expertise is preferred.  Experience working in cloud data platforms like GCP, Big Query, Qubole etc.  Experience working with Google web analytics data is a plus.  Excellent communication and storytelling ability with track record of translating model results into business insights, and then into actionable recommendations.  Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. As such, we will consider all qualified applicants for employment and do not discriminate in connection with employment decisions on the basis of an applicant or employee’s race, color, national origin, ethnicity, ancestry, citizenship status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, marital status, personal appearance (including height and weight), sexual orientation, family responsibilities, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy status (including childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), education, genetic characteristics or information, political affiliation, military or veteran status or other classifications protected by applicable federal, state and local laws in the jurisdictions where Gannett employs employees. In addition, Gannett Co., Inc. will provide applicants who require a reasonable accommodation, as a result of an applicant’s disability or religion, to complete this employment application and/or any other process in connection with an individuals’ application for employment with Gannett Co., Inc. Applicants who require such accommodation should contact Gannett Co., Inc.’s Recruitment Department at Recruit@gannett.com.

job_title: Associate Director, Data Science Excellence and Innovation
job_Description: If you want to have an impact on the lives of patients with cancer, take a look at Sumitomo Dainippon Pharma Oncology (SDP Oncology). With our diverse pipeline, passionate team, and extensive resources, we offer abundant opportunities to contribute to the transformation of cancer care. We know that every team member, regardless of their role, plays a critical part in advancing research and making a difference in the lives of patients with cancer. The Associate Director of DSEI will be a key member of one or more clinical projects. S/he will be responsible for the development of data strategy, integration, mining and monitoring solutions and will be the leader to optimize trial monitoring via modern statistical and data science methods and tools. Specifically, s/he will drive the automation of the data reporting and visualization, apply innovative design and/or analysis methods, conduct modeling and simulation, and lead external collaborations on data solutions etc. Responsibilities Serve as DSEI lead for one or more clinical projects. Responsible for data strategy, data integration, mining and monitoring solutions. Lead the efforts to optimize trial monitoring via modern statistical and data science methods and tools. Collaborate with data science teams to drive data science innovations to clinical trials. Collaborate with clinical development, Clinical safety, PK and Biomarker team for continuous and effective clinical data analysis Lead and support the development and implementation for modern statistical and data mining techniques. Lead and support the development and implementation for modern computational tools. Manage vendor relationships and mentor junior team members as appropriate. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications PhD/MS in statistics, biostatistics, data science or computer science. PhD is preferred. At least 5-years of clinical trial experience. Broad and deep understanding of statistical and data science principles, up-to-date statistical and data science methodologies, and their applications into clinical trials. Strong leadership in a multi-functional project environment: able to manage many projects simultaneously as well as conflicting priorities. Effective writing and communication skills: able to author various reports or documents, to help team understand complex design and analysis strategy, to present data solutions and explain to team clearly. Skilled in R programming is required. Experienced with Python and other statistical and data science programming language is a plus. Experience managing direct reports and/or cross-functional team members is preferred. Confidential Data  : All information (written, verbal, electronic, etc.) that an employee encounters is considered confidential. Compliance  : Achieve and maintain Compliance with all applicable regulatory, legal and operational rules and procedures, by ensuring that all plans and activities for and on behalf of SDP Oncology are carried out with the "best" industry practices and the highest ethical standards. Mental/Physical Requirements  : Fast paced environment handling multiple demands. Must be able to exercise appropriate judgment as necessary. Requires a high level of initiative and independence. Excellent written and oral communication skills required. Requires ability to use a personal computer for extended periods of time. Upholding Equal Opportunity:  In accordance with Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action, Sumitomo Dainippon Pharma Oncology, Inc. is committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, ancestry, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, military/veteran status, or membership in any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Health & Safety:  To maintain the health and safety of our employees, patients, and affiliates, as well as comply with the vaccination requirements of our partners, employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID -19. Candidates must provide proof of full vaccination as a condition of employment within 5 days of receiving an offer from SDP Oncology. In accordance with Equal Employment Opportunity laws, exemptions for religious and medical reasons will be considered subject to federal and state law accommodation requests.

At Hypersonix, we build a sophisticated AI Platform that powers enterprises with actionable Intelligence across their database or application systems. Hypersonix empowers every decision-maker with real-time insights, predictions, and recommendations to take timely actions leading to business success. Roles and Responsibilities  As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work closely with Engineering/Product/Implementation teams to build state-of-the-art ML-based solutions for B2B SaaS apps. You will leverage not only advanced techniques for predictions, time-series forecasting, NLP, optimization, but also a deep understanding of business issues and problems.  Apply excellent problem-solving skills to deconstruct business problems and formulate solutions from first-principles  Contribute to building the data science roadmap and the core intelligence powering Hypersonix products  Collaborate with product management and engineering to design the product strategy, identify key metrics to drive the business, and support product development with proof-of-concept demonstrations  Perform rapid prototyping of experimental solutions and develop robust, sustainable, and scalable production systems  Work with large scale data (currently in the retail and CPG domains) to feed the data science algorithms  Apply out-of-the-box algorithms as well as develop custom algorithms as needed  Drive productization of code to be used in enterprise software products  You will work with fellow data scientists and mentor junior team members  Requirements  Experience – 3+ years of experience in solving data science problems that have driven value to customers  Hands-on programming skills and ability to write modular and scalable code in Python. Knowledge of SQL is required  Solid understanding of probability, statistics, optimization, machine learning. Extensive experience in one or a few specific techniques is an advantage  Experience in building analytical or data-driven software products in an engineering organization interfacing with other teams and departments. Familiarity with software development tools such as git, AWS, bash, Airflow  Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, operations research, or related  This is a remote position.

job_title: Data Analytics Architect - US Remote Eligible
job_Description: Job Description: WHO WE ARE: We’re passionate about food and driven by data. Do you want to impact our future through data, analytics and innovative technology? Do you thrive on leading big things and making it happen? Bring your passion, expertise and problem-solving skills to the table and make an impact. General Mills is reshaping the future, and technology & data play an important role for us. Your technology experience will help us get the right data and solutions at the right time, every time. As one of the world’s leading food companies, General Mills operates across the globe with more than 100 recognizable consumer brands, including: Cheerios, LÄRABAR, Pillsbury, Yoplait, Annie’s Homegrown, Totino’s, Epic Provisions and Blue Buffalo. WHAT YOU’LL DO: The Analytic Capability Architect drives the planning and execution of a wide variety of existing and new analytic technology solutions. You will own the solution roadmaps for analytic technology capabilities across product teams, and act as a key enabler of these solutions. You will ensure alignment between product teams and technology teams and drive the successful execution of analytic solutions. In this role, you will: Drive the analysis of business analytical needs and own the roadmap for phased delivery of analytic technology solutions Lead the analytic technology capability discussions with product teams as it relates to their use cases and product roadmaps Collaborate with the technology teams for determining the feasibility of solutions and timelines Define value for the use case specific analytic technology capabilities, and prioritize accordingly Own communicating impacts, dependencies, risks, etc. between product teams and technology teams as it relates to the analytic technology capabilities roadmap Identify synergy opportunities between analytic solutions being developed across use cases Help define and champion processes related to the consumption of analytic technology solutions Participate in sprint planning and define current and future requirements WHO YOU ARE: Bachelor’s degree 7 years of experience demonstrating a high degree of proficiency in designing and developing complex, high-quality analytic solutions 2 years of experience building analytic solutions in the cloud Experience in business requirements analysis and mapping it to the analytic technology solutions Experience with a breadth of Analytic technologies, including solutions leveraging Artificial Intelligence, Cloud and Business Intelligence capabilities Experience in Agile Development, with specific analyst (or similar) experience preferred Ability to phase the delivery of analytic solutions such that it can meet immediate needs, while building towards the long-term strategic solution Ability to understand and adhere to data and analytic governance principles Collaborative, with the ability to coordinate with multiple teams at the same time, understand their requirements and be able to map them to analytic solutions Company Overview: We exist to make food the world loves. But we do more than that. Our company is a place that prioritizes being a force for good, a place to expand learning, explore new perspectives and reimagine new possibilities, every day. We look for people who want to bring their best — bold thinkers with big hearts who challenge one other and grow together. Because becoming the undisputed leader in food means surrounding ourselves with people who are hungry for what’s next.

Love cutting-edge tech? We do too. At Epsilon, we do more than collect and store data. We help some of the world’s biggest brands connect with their customers by offering digital experiences people actually like. We’re looking for an experienced  Senior Data Scientist  to help us build dynamic and data-driven machine learning solutions in a big data environment. In this role, you will help our product managers and software engineers unlock the power of machine learning and predictive modeling to do some truly amazing things for our clients. Better yet, we’re growing fast, which means you can too. From learning new technologies to collaborating with some of the brightest—and kindest—people in the world, there’s a lot to love about a career with us. Join a team where you’re empowered to do epic things and unleash your full potential. What you’ll do: Develop an understanding of Epsilon’s current analytic capabilities and proprietary datasets. Use your machine learning expertise to research and recommend the best analytic approaches to solving the most difficult marketing problems facing our clients. Identify new analytic capabilities and compare/contrast with existing methods. Design, implement, and validate productized analytic pipelines at scale using a variety of tools (AWS Sagemaker, Databricks, EMR, Spark, Python, Mllib, Git, etc.). Participate fully in our collaborative culture by sharing knowledge, debating techniques, and conducting research to advance the collective knowledge and skills of the team. About you: You embrace challenges and take the initiative to solve them quickly You do your best work in a dynamic and busy team setting You strive for technical excellence in yourself and encourage it in others You are interested in learning and growing your skillset What you’ll bring: Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related field. 3+ years of experience delivering data science, machine learning and AI solutions at scale. Experience implementing a range of machine learning methods from basic descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing and feature transformation to complex dimension reduction, supervised or unsupervised learning, and model tuning and validation. Coding proficiency in Python is required and additional programming languages such as R, SQL, C, C++ is a plus. Project work using large scale distributed computing systems like Databricks, Spark, or EMR. Experience working with cloud infrastructure services like Amazon Web Services and MS Azure. Familiarity with code repositories and continuous integration (Git/Jenkins). Knowledge of DNN models using TensorFlow, Keras or Pytorch. Prior project work in NLP is a plus Ability to manage multiple data science projects concurrently. Additional Information Great People, Deserve Great Benefits We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career. Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. Prime Clerk, part of Kroll’s Business Services division, is the leader in global, end-to-end restructuring administration services. RESPONSIBILITIES:   The Senior Data Analyst position is primarily responsible for supporting the Client Services department related to data parsing, importing, managing and analyzing of client data. Independently define and develop solutions, with minimal direction, for a wide range of technical problems. Participate in team meetings and other collaborations, as well as design and peer reviews. Be flexible; prepared to approach things laterally; able to think outside the box. Interface with business stakeholders, to identify or clarify requirements in order to address various problems. SQL knowledge is required Experience creating and supporting complex SQL Server objects, batch processes and batch scripts  Experience performing complex data analysis of large datasets  Experience tuning T-SQL queries  Experience using source control  Deep expertise with advanced Excel and data manipulation  VBA Scripting  Data cleansing and data manipulation  Ability to understand complex business processes and adapt solutions to meet the needs of the business  Excellent communication skills for interaction with peers, managers and business stakeholders  Must enjoy and have experience working in a fast paced environment  Ability to quickly realign with shifting priorities  Reporting Services (SSRS) experience a plus  Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communities  Experience working with diverse teams  In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com. Summary:  This position is responsible for managing and directing customer, behavioral, and agency predictive analytics throughout the data science lifecycle from problem statement, data exploration, modeling, and deployment. Recommending strategies based on analytics, models, and market research to improve effectiveness across related business units and functions. What You’ll Be Doing: Manage a team of data scientists to translate business problems into actionable analytic projects that drive business performance. Assist in hiring and training of data scientists. Motivate direct reports to achieve business objectives. In collaboration with Enterprise Analytics leadership, identify, adopt, and maintain analytic best practices around predictive modeling techniques, programming languages, and software applications. Establish and maintain best practices for model maintenance, validation, and refresh. Partner with corporate IT, data office, and business partners to develop and maintain data marts at the customer, household, and agency level for use in predictive modeling. Work with the data office, IT, business units, and third-party companies to assess and incorporate demographic, firmographic, geographic, telematic, internet-of-things (IOT), and other data sources for analytic benefit. Collaborate with the Personal and Commercial Lines, Sales and Marketing, Customer Experience, and other internal client teams to support corporate initiatives using predictive analytics. Build effective relationships with internal customers. Regularly report project status and prioritize as needed based on stakeholder feedback. Prioritize work of direct reports based on input from business partners. Synthesize findings, analysis, and recommendations into senior level presentations that convey insights and recommendations through compelling, persuasive, and efficient story-telling, while maintaining a balance between key insights and mastery of details. What You’ll Bring To The Company: Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree in statistics or related areas that includes research methodology, advanced analytics, data mining techniques, statistical/predictive modeling and applied statistics is strongly preferred. 7+ years’ experience with advanced use of statistics and dynamic model building strongly preferred including cluster analysis, latent class, logistic regression, decision trees, and other non-linear algorithms, linear regression techniques (GLM), and forecasting/time series Direct experience with large data sets, SAS, Python, or R, and relational database models such as Oracle, DB2, and SQL Server, and Snowflake. Familiarity with AWS platform is a plus. Prior experience managing a team of statistical analysts or data scientists preferred. Prior insurance industry experience including customer centric, behavioral, marketing, segmentation, distribution analytics or equivalent experience, is required. Candidate must have an aptitude for critical thinking and problem resolution and strong communication skills. About Us: Grange Insurance Company, with $3 billion in assets and more than $1.3 billion in annual revenue, is an insurance provider founded in 1935 and based in Columbus, Ohio. Through its network of independent agents, Grange offers auto, home, life and business insurance protection. Life insurance offered by Grange Life Insurance and Kansas City Life Insurance. Grange Insurance Company and its affiliates serve policyholders in Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kentucky, Michigan, Minnesota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia and Wisconsin. Who We Are: We are committed to an inclusive work environment where we welcome and value diversity and inclusion. We hire great talent from a wide variety of backgrounds, and our associates are our biggest strength. The diversity of our associates, their backgrounds, experiences, and individual differences are the foundation for our success. Our inclusive culture empowers all of us to “Be One Team”, “Deliver Excellence”, “Communicate Openly”, “Do the Right Thing”, and “Solve Creatively for Tomorrow”. We have active Associate Resource Groups and a Diversity and Inclusion Team, that focuses on professional development, networking, business value and community outreach; all which encourage and facilitate an environment that fosters learning, innovation, and growth. Together we use our individual experiences to learn from one another and grow as professionals and as humans. We welcome the unique contributions that you bring from education, opinions, culture, beliefs, race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, handicap, disability, sexual orientation, gender stereotyping, gender identity or expression, genetic information, ancestry, pregnancy, veteran status, and citizenship. Grange Enterprise is proud to be part of the CEO Action for Diversity and Inclusion™, a national initiative of more than 1400 CEOs working for the advancement of diversity and inclusion within the workplace.

The Opportunity: Our ultimate goal is to make data-driven decisions the core of everything we do in debt settlement, leveraging strategic use of financial, credit, and consumer data across all aspects of our products and operations. In this exceptional analytical opportunity (hybrid remote position located in either Tempe, AZ or San Mateo CA), you will help make data and data-driven solutions a core competency of our products and operations through the application of descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytical techniques. In addition to providing valuable insights and analytically driven recommendations on a daily basis, you will debate and influence business, product, and technical strategies to help us solidify Freedom’s top spot in the debt settlement industry. This position is compensated with a base salary and quarterly bonuses based on individual and company performance. Job title delineation for this open Staff/Sr Data Analyst position will be dependent on applicant’s technical proficiency and relevant work experience to do this role. How You’ll Contribute: Identify answers to challenging business and product questions based on the relationships, patterns, trends, and behaviors hidden in financial, credit, and customer data. Extract answers using descriptive and predictive analytical techniques, such as clustering, modeling, optimization methods, and reporting historical insights. Prepare, manipulate and derive answers with SQL, Python, and R. Create, display, and automate relevant reporting and analytical visualization in Tableau. Partner closely with internal stakeholders to identify highest value business and product questions to work on at any given time. Ideate with your partners when deriving answers to business and product questions. Prescribe solutions to help your partners make better decisions more often with data. Why This Opportunity Is Unique: Work in collaborative and growth-focused business environment that encourages innovative problem solving with a lot of opportunity for advancement. Leveraging modern analytics tools, you’ll have a opportunity have a direct impact on sales performance. Voted a Best Place to Work multiple times by our employees, most recently #1 in Phoenix for 2 years in a row! Benefits start within 30 days: 401k with employer match 3 weeks’ paid vacation (increased with tenure) 9 paid holidays & 5 sick days Paid time off for volunteer work and on your birthday What You’ll Bring: S, M.S, or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as analytics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, information systems, or equivalent experience. M.S. or Ph.D. is preferred. 3+ years related business experience Proficient using SQL. Advanced knowledge is preferred. Have used Python, R, or SAS to conduct descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytical techniques. Experience with clustering, regression, decision tree, and time series analysis is preferred. Have experience creating and automating charts, tables, graphs, and dashboards to summarize results and visually share analytical narratives to explain data-driven insights. Have experience using Tableau, or other relevant visualization software, to create, display, and automate all relevant reporting and analytical visualization. Like operating in a complex, cross-functional organization where you need to collaborate with others. Bring a new and diverse perspective. An active listener and have exceptional communication skills. Articulate with both business and technical partners. Know how to tell compelling stories with data. Enthusiastic about Freedom’s culture.  About Us: Freedom Financial Network is a leading digital personal finance company, built to help people. We do what traditional banks don’t: Put people first. We believe in treating people like humans, not account numbers. We help everyday people get on, and stay on, the path to a brighter financial future, with innovative technology and personalized support at every step. We help people control expenses, manage debt, save money, plan ahead, and make better financial decisions. By leveraging our proprietary data and analytics and artificial intelligence we offer solutions tailored for each step of a consumer's financial journey, including personal loans, home equity loans, help with debt, and even financial tools and education. With 2,400 employees across California, Arizona and Texas, we have served more than 1 million customers, resolved more than $15 billion in consumer debt and originated $6.5 billion in loans over the course of our 20 years in business. Driven by our core values, we’re passionate about supporting our communities and proudly awarded over $500,000 in grants distributed by the Freedom Foundation Fund and the Freedom Family Fund in 2021. We believe in a culture led by diversity, equity, and inclusion, and encourage our employees to bring their full selves to work every day. Our diversity-focused Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) are open to all, whether a member of the ERG community or an ally of the group and we are a member of the Fintech Racial Equity Coalition to address and improve inequality in the fintech industry. And finally, we take great pride in our achievements. This year we topped the list of Best Place to Work by the Phoenix Business Journal, were a top 100 Corporate Philanthropist by the San Francisco Business Times, a 2021 Most Admired Company and a Tech Company with the Best Company Culture by BestCompaniesAz, a 2021 Top Work Places winner by AZcentral and a BuiltIn Best Places to Work winner, to name a few. Attention Agencies & Search Firms:  We do not accept unsolicited candidate resumes or profiles. Please do not reach out to anyone within Freedom Financial Network (FFN) to market your services or candidates. All inquiries should be directed to Talent Acquisition only. We reserve the right to hire any candidates sent unsolicited and will not pay any fees without a contract signed by FFN’s Talent Acquisition leader.

Overview: Tantus Technologies, Inc. (Tantus) - recognized by the Washington Post as a Top Workplace - is seeking a Lead Data Scientist with focus on Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning/NLP, within Federal government and in health-care space to help Tantus build solutions for our customers that enable them to extract value and seek insights from their data. You will be responsible for architecting, engineering, accessing and manipulating large data sets both structured and un-structured from varied sources. You will analyze data using statistical analysis, Machine Learning, and tool-sets to gain insights such as trends, predictions, sentiments, themes etc. The Lead Data Scientist will interpret results from these statistical and ML models and present them utilize visualization tools to clients and stakeholders. The Data Scientist will also assist with defining corporate Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning strategy. In accordance with applicable law and Company policy, full vaccination against COVID-19 is required for this position, and proof of full vaccination status will be required on the first day of employment.  What You'll Do: Lead the development of Data Analytics and AI/ML/NLP solutions by translating high-level requirements into technical tasks Data architecture, Data manipulation and data engineering of structured and unstructured data based on the solution requirements Data acquisition using data extractions, data matching between multiple systems, transformations, cleansing, and loading. Use big data and cloud platforms and toolset to develop AI/ML/NLP and data analytics solutions Engineer and create complex research datasets by manipulating typically large volume transactional data for use by research analysts in advanced analytical research and studies. Develop model for predictive, prescriptive, optimization, forecasting, classification and sentiment analysis Interpret and communicate results from statistical and mathematical models to management and stakeholders Use advance data visualizations and interpretation to present results to stakeholders Assist with defining and driving corporate AI strategies Must Haves: Masters or Bachelor's degree in Applied Math, Computer Science or other related field Overall 10+ years of experience in the data science field At least 3-4 years of experience in Data Analytics in Health Care domain Expertize in Medicare/Medicaid claims, beneficiary and provider information, etc. Experience in data analysis, cleansing, engineering and modeling Experience programming in Python, R, SAS for complex data manipulation, statistical analysis, and machine learning Experience working with Data Analytical tools like MicroStrategy, Tableau Experience working with RDBMS and non-relational databases Experience implementing solution leveraging cloud technologies for at least one cloud platform provider (e.g. AWS, Azure or Google) Experience working in Agile, DevOps, ITIL and other SW development methodologies and frameworks Good communication skills Nice to Haves: Experience working on projects in the federal domain Experience in MLOps At least 3-4 years of experience in developing solution in AI/ML/NLP Experience using statistical, Natural Language Processing (NLP) algorithms and models

The mission of the Data Science team is to enhance Cvent’s products with AI and machine learning driven features, and to enable the company to make data-informed decisions at all levels. Cvent has a vast amount of data, and significant domain expertise, which we are using to design intelligent features that deliver value to our customers. We are on AWS, use Tableau as a reporting & dashboarding tool, and have recently started using Snowflake as an enterprise data warehouse.   We are hiring a Data Analyst II to work on statistical analysis of data, creating dashboards, and building and maintaining documentation on data. You must be highly collaborative and used to taking initiatives: you will work with data scientists, software developers and product managers on a daily basis. You will be an integral part of a fast-growing team, strongly committed to impacting the company via industry-leading machine learning, data products and data analytics.   What you will do:   Perform statistical analysis of data.  Design randomized controlled trials (A/B tests), and analyze results.  Build and maintain dashboards for the Data Science team, using Tableau, Amazon QuickSight, and possibly other tools.  Understand Cvent's data: for example, what data points are captured from a particular product line and how specific data tables were created.  Use this understanding of data to create and maintain data dictionaries relevant to the Data Science team.  Communicate relevant findings and results to the team.   Basic qualifications:   A Bachelor's degree in statistics or another quantitative field.  At least 2 years of experience working as a data analyst in industry.  Proficiency working with relational (SQL) databases.  Proven skills in data visualization and dashboard creation.  Deep experience with Tableau.  Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests.  Critical thinking and strong problem-solving ability.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.   Advanced qualifications:    Master's or higher degree in statistics or another quantitative field.  Proficiency in the Python language.  Experience with noSQL data stores.  Familiarity with AWS services, especially QuickSight as a dashboarding tool.  Familiarity with Snowflake.  Understanding of data modeling and data store management.  Conceptual understanding of machine learning.  Proven ability for proactive, independent work with minimal supervision.   If you are a good fit for the role, please apply! Your resume should be no more than two pages in length.

Senior Data Scientist - Remote   -   ( 22000305 ) Description Position Summary  As an experienced Data Scientist, you will be responsible for utilizing modern Advanced Analytics methods (i.e. Machine Learning) to examine business questions and uncover novel insights. You will work closely with application architects to integrate results into operational platforms, including SAS, Hadoop, Tableau and SQL architectures. The position includes: analytic computing, data analytics, Machine Learning/predictive modeling and communication of solutions and results.  You are  You are analytically driven, intellectually curious, and like to create data science solutions applying Machine Learning algorithms to solve challenging business problems. Solutions enable business team members to leverage data and actionable insights to make better decisions across value chain. You are fueled by collaboration and are able to transform conceptual thinking into executable insights. You enjoy collaborating with multi-disciplinary team including data engineers, business analysts, software developers and functional business experts and leaders. You also have gained enough experience to oversee more junior data scientists and lead core components of high-impact projects.  Qualifications You have Master's degree with 7+ years of experience, or Bachelor's degree with 10+ years of experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied mathematics or related field  Experience with parallelism in applying machine learning  Extensive Experience in SQL query and optimization  7+ years of Modeling/Development experience  Experience leading key analytics / ML modeling solutions  Familiarity with at least 2 of the following modeling software packages: R, Python, SPSS, SAS  Experience bringing prototypes to production on Hadoop and/or NoSQL platforms; familiarity with Machine Learning Ops beneficial  Experience with visualization software (Tableau, DOMO, Spotfire, Qlikview)   Additional Qualifications  Familiar with a range of machine learning models; for example: Random Forest, GBM, XGboost, GLM/glmnet, Deep learning convolutional models, recurrent models, and dimensionality reduction methods, including PCA, SVD , Isomap  Familiar with a range of machine learning related tools, for example: including Python scikit-learn, Pandas, numpy, R caret, H2O, Tensorflow, Keras  Results driven with a positive can do attitude  Individual with curiosity to find stories hidden in a large repository of data  Effective communication skills to work with partners to identify business questions and work through their data to search for answers. Tell meaningful story with data and explain complex solutions in a simple way.  Expected to actively participate in defining and governing our analytics strategy  Strong in executing data science driven projects as we build out capabilities and our technical architecture.  Strong business acumen, with ability to draw clear connections between data modeling activities and business challenges/opportunities  Proven ability to organize, prioritize and handle time constraints and manage shifting priorities.  Consistent accuracy and thoroughness in performing work assignments  Ability to work collaboratively with development/implementation staff through the design and build of new business processes and systems  Understanding of best-in-class model and data configuration and development processes  Understanding of data science trends and potential future state technologies   You will  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify highest value activities for Advanced Data and Analytics group  Work closely with Data Architecture Lead to understand systems opportunities and constraints for maximally monetizing the Guardian Enterprise Data Infrastructure  Develop relationships with business team members by being proactive, displaying an increasing understanding of the business processes and by recommending innovative solutions  Provide data modeling, mining, pattern analysis, data visualization and machine learning solutions to address customer needs  Communicate project output in terms of customer value, business objectives, and product opportunity  Mentor data analytics associates on project delivery and solutioning direction  Attend industry conferences to stay current on industry trends, challenges, and potential market opportunities  Promote data science methods and processes across functions   Location  New York NY, Holmdel NJ or Stamford CT with work from home flexibility. 1 - 2 days a week onsite  Up to 10% travel within US.  Location & Vaccination Requirements  The primary location for this position is New York, Holmdel or Stamford.  Covid – 19 vaccinations required for this position.  Any offer of employment will be contingent upon the candidate’s affirmation of being Full Vaccinated prior to commencing employment in the new role. AYTM “Ask Your Target Market” is hiring a Senior Data Analyst specializing in data processing and research analytics to join our growing research services team. This position will assist in determining appropriate data processing needs for clients and execute data analysis associated with quantitative market research projects. The data analyst works with internal research team members, Account Management and Business Development teams to design and provide customized back-end deliverables either independently, or with vendor support. Founded in 2009, AYTM is a fast-growing and profitable company that is the favorite market research platform for many of the world's leading brands and creative agencies. We are a rapidly expanding technology company focused on empowering market researchers with innovative technology, access to millions of consumers and high-quality service. We offer a Zero Commute, 100% remote work environment, flexible hours, a friendly and energizing Slack-connected team, competitive salary and top-notch benefits. Responsibilities:   Work within the research services team to conduct full and partial service quantitative market research projects across numerous research methodologies and a diverse set of clients.  Execute data-centric deliverables including data manipulation (e.g., stacking, appends, weighting), custom data tables/crosstabs, interactive template-based deliverables (e.g., conjoint simulators), statistical analyses (e.g., regression, correspondence, discriminant, factor, cluster), and data visualization and reporting.  Work closely with internal team members to ensure the smooth execution and on-time delivery of research services including programmed survey links, custom data tables, simulators, reports, and other deliverables.  Work directly with clients in an “Assisted-DIY” fashion, supporting AYTM end users by providing expert advising on advanced methodologies that are automated on the platform (e.g., choice-based conjoint, TURF, etc.), answering data and analysis questions, and executing one-off analysis requests as needed.  Serve as a knowledge resource to other internal teams, including Business Development/Account Management, Client Training, and Product Development.  Co-ordinate with external vendors for any back-end requirements.  Work/communicate both as an individual and as part of a team in a matrixed environment.  Assist in production and process development of data processing and analytic analysis automation.   Qualifications:   5+ years client-facing experience in data processing as relates to quantitative market research on the supplier side.  Strong experience with data-intensive aspects of online survey research: programming, data analysis, data processing and advanced methodologies.  Skilled user of the Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint. Must be an expert-level user of Excel.  Advanced proficiency in at least one data processing or statistical analysis software (example: Q, Quantum, SPSS, MarketSight, Decipher, IBM SurveyProfessional, R).  Advanced understanding of data structure, manipulation & storage, including best practices.  Ability to translate conceptual objectives into actionable data and analytics related tasks.  Experience using one or more online survey platforms.  Strong written and verbal skills and should enjoy taking a consultative and collaborative approach – both with clients and fellow team members.  Undergraduate degree in marketing, social sciences, computer science, mathematics or other related field, with a quantitative emphasis on statistics or research methods.   What we offer:  We are a virtual company, which means you’ll be working remotely from the location of your choosing (home, coffee house, library). While being a zero-emission commute and providing you with an amazing level of freedom, convenience, and flexibility, it requires a certain inner discipline and capacity to be effective at a distance. Remote work experience is preferred, but not required. This is a full-time, remote-work position. Additional benefits include:   Unlimited PTO - With a required minimum number of days taken each year  Affordable Insurance -$0 deductible Health plans plus dental, vision, and more!  401k retirement - Account with automatic company contributions  Flex Work - Work when and how it makes sense for your life, and your team  Dependent Care - a pre-tax benefit account that you can fund to pay for eligible dependent care services  Professional Development - Bring your professional Development needs to the table and get your career nourished  Travel Programs - We have various company-funded travel programs for ALL employees despite role or level.  In-Home Snack allowance - Who doesn’t love some yummies to get you through the day?  Cellphone/Internet credits - Get tax-free credits to use toward your cell phone and internet utilities.  Equipment and Structured Onboarding - We will provide you will the equipment and tools you need along with great onboarding courses to make sure you are set up for success.  Paid Volunteer Time - We support you helping others  Great colleagues and an opportunity to sail into uncharted waters with a profitable company that is changing its industry!   While this is a remote-work position, employees should reside within the following states: AL, AK, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IN, KY, LA, ME, MI, MS, MT, NC, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, ND, OH, OK, PA, RI, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA **Aytm is an  Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture. Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Senior Data Analyst to sit within Janssen Business Technology. At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives.
